data.prayer: Father, knowing that teachers will be judged more strictly, help the local leaders in Gulf, Papua New Guinea to be careful with their words.
data.verse: Not many of you should become teachers, my brothers, for you know that we who teach will be judged with greater strictness.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Gulf, Papua New Guinea
data.section_summary: What people or activities could you pray for in this photo?

data.prayer: Spirit, disrupt complacency in the 36,374 believers living in the state of Gulf. Remind them you are coming soon.
data.verse: Therefore, stay awake, for you do not know on what day your Lord is coming.

data.section_summary: On average, 32 babies will be born in the next 100 hours to families who are far from God in Gulf, Papua New Guinea.
data.prayer: Jesus, reveal yourself to these new families.
Father, we pray that the state of Gulf be filled with simple churches in every neighborhood.
data.verse: For the earth will be full of the knowledge of the Lord, as the waters cover the sea.

data.prayer: Lord, please provide elders whose hearts are completely yours in every town in the state of Gulf.
data.verse: The reason I left you in Crete was that you might put in order what was left unfinished and appoint elders in every town, as I directed you.

data.prayer: Lord, use Google search to lead people in Gulf, Papua New Guinea to the gospel today.
Father, it’s possible most of the 8,890 lost people in  Gulf, Papua New Guinea have never held or opened a Bible. Please change this, Father.
data.verse: Yet faith comes from listening to this Good News—the Good News about Christ.

data.prayer: Spirit, cause the 36,374 believers in Gulf to obey with immediate, radical, costly obedience, like Abraham.
data.verse: Then God said, “Take your son, your only son, whom you love — Isaac — and go to the region of Moriah. Sacrifice him there as a burnt offering on a mountain I will show you.” Early the next morning Abraham got up and loaded his donkey. He took with him two of his servants and his son Isaac. When he had cut enough wood for the burnt offering, he set out for the place God had told him about.

data.section_summary:
the state of Gulf, Papua New Guinea has a population of 158,200.

We estimate Gulf has 36,374 people who might know Jesus, 112,936 people who might know about Jesus culturally, and 8,890 people who do not know Jesus.

This is 1 believer for every 4 neighbors who need Jesus.
